DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Upper Limit of Normal Outcome Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a medical procedure was performed that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function for which the result is related by the top value of the range of statistical characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Upper Limit of Normal Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function for which the result is related by the top value of the range of statistical characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Creatinine Upper Limit of Normal Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the Serum Creatinine less
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the Serum Creatinine less than or equal to ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine <=1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, grade 1 per CTCAE Version 4.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Serum Creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum Creatinine in normal range:

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine <= 1.5 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's serum creatinine between 1.5 and 1.9 mg/dL within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 times the laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional/laboratory (ULN) or creatinine clearance greater than 50mL/min/1.73m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) or creatinine clearance (CrCL) or estimated Glomerular filtration rate (GFR)  of greater than or equal to 60 mL/min estimated using either the Cockcroft-Gault equation, the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study, or as reported in the comprehensive metabolic panel/basic metabolic panel (eGFR) within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 28 days before study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) or creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance (CrCL) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min (estimated using Cockcroft-Gault equation) within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) or estimated Glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using either the Cockcroft-Gault equation, the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study, or as reported in the comprehensive metabolic panel/basic metabolic panel (eGFR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional/laboratory upper limit of normal (ULN) or estimated Glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using either the Cockcroft-Gault equation, the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study, or as reported in the comprehensive metabolic panel/basic metabolic panel (eGFR) within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is GFR greater than or equal to 60mL/min/1.73m2 measured using Cockcroft-Gault equation or the estimated glomerular filtration rate from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using the Cockcroft-Gault formula for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using the Cockcroft-Gault formula for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 14 days prior to second registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min within 14 days prior to second registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is calculated creatinine clearance (CrCL) of greater than or equal to 50 mL/min by the Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance (CrCL) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min by the Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 28 days before Step 1/Study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance (CrCL) of greater than or equal to 30 mL/min by the Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) or calculated creatinine clearance (CrCL) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min by the Cockcroft-Gault formula?
